[P1] Cron-event prompt selection can be accidentally triggered by leftover, unrelated system events

`hasCronEvents` is currently `isCronEvent && pendingEvents.length > 0`, so any queued system event (including ones unrelated to the cron reminder, e.g. an earlier exec.* event queued to the same sessionKey) will switch the prompt to `CRON_EVENT_PROMPT`. This can lead to the model “relaying a reminder” when the system events aren’t actually a cron reminder.

Consider keying off a cron-specific marker (similar to `Exec finished`) or using `contextKey`/sessionKey isolation for cron jobs so the prompt only switches when the pending events are actually cron reminder events.
